GDP revised up to 3.1% in third quarter  —  The U.S. economy grew at a 3.1% annualized pace in the third quarter — stronger than previously thought, the Commerce Department said on Thursday. … By the numbers: The revision is an upgrade from the initial estimate of 2.8% growth in the July-Sept. period.

Dow plunges more than 1,100 points and marked its longest losing streak since 1974  —  New York CNN  —  The Dow plunged Wednesday on a disappointing outlook from the Federal Reserve.  In the process, the blue-chip index extended its losing streak to 10 days — the longest such stretch since Gerald Ford was president.
